discussion.author: cj-mclaughlin
discussion.text: Regarding the name being an acronym, this is a wrapper for the ITK package https://itk.org.

discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: ITK is a bit terse as package names go. Would a more descriptive name be better?

discussion.author: cj-mclaughlin
discussion.text: Despite the current package only having image registration, I feel like it's for the best to have a generic name, as I am looking to implement more ITK methods. Would JuliaITK be preferable?

discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: I have no idea what ITK methods are, which is kind of my point. JuliaITK would not be preferrable, see the Julia Package Naming Guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1

discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: Given that it's a wrapper for the existing ITK package, the name is üëç

discussion.author: cj-mclaughlin
discussion.text: Great, thanks for your time. Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.

discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: No, that's good. There's a customary waiting period for a new package but you're good to go.
